Summary: Animation approaches in MauiReactor: property-based, AnimationController, and native MAUI.
Remarks: MauiReactor supports three complementary animation strategies: 1) Property-based (RxAnimation): declaratively animate component properties between states with WithAnimation(duration, easing). 2) AnimationController: compose Sequence/Parallel timelines with tween animations (Double, CubicBezierPath, QuadraticBezierPath) and update state via OnTick for complex motion and coordination. 3) Standard .NET MAUI animations: operate directly on native controls when needed. All can be combined within a single component depending on your scenario.
Example:
Examples: 
- Property-based: Image().Opacity(State.On ? 1 : 0).WithAnimation(600)
- AnimationController: new AnimationController { new SequenceAnimation { new DoubleAnimation().StartValue(0).TargetValue(100).OnTick(v => SetState(s => s.X = v)) } }
- Native MAUI: get native reference and call TranslateTo/ScaleTo as required
